title: Trump Is Undermining Trust in Official Economic Statistics. China Shows Where That Path Can Lead
author: Louise Matsakis

title: Trump Is Undermining Trust in Official Economic Statistics. China Shows Where That Path Can Lead
author: Louise Matsakis

title: Why the US Is Racing to Build a Nuclear Reactor on the Moon
author: Becky Ferreira
summary: NASA is racing to build a nuclear reactor on the moon by 2030 in a new moon race, which could transform space exploration and industry by providing abundant power for lunar and Martian missions. This initiative aims to establish a permanent presence in space and pave the way for large-scale scientific endeavors beyond Earth.

title: Leak Reveals the Workaday Lives of North Korean IT Scammers
author: Matt Burgess
summary: Leaked data reveals the meticulous operations of North Korean IT scammers, showcasing their use of tech tools like Google, Slack, and GitHub to track job applications and earnings with precision.

title: Mysterious Crime Spree Targeted National Guard Equipment Stashes
author: Dell Cameron
summary: Recent break-ins at Tennessee National Guard armories reveal vulnerabilities to theft, raising concerns about insider involvement and potential exploitation by extremist groups seeking military equipment.

title: Encryption Made for Police and Military Radios May Be Easily Cracked
author: Kim Zetter
summary: Researchers found vulnerabilities in encryption algorithms used in radios for police and military forces, making communications susceptible to eavesdropping. End-to-end encryption solutions endorsed by ETSI also have security flaws, potentially exposing voice and data communications to decryption and manipulation.
